Description: Much of rim and bowl of pottery shallow bowl, mended from several fragments; part of small disc foot preserved. Rounded everted rim. Decorated on exterior with sets of two narrow brown lines, and a broader one around the rim. Interior has broad bands of black, with added red and white lines.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 228, no. 140)
Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 116, pl. XXXVI, no. 329.1)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GO.235)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.5943 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
